I think you may have a reserved 2GB of disk space for root.  Thats why your disk is reporting 100% full.
how can I verify this?
I'm just checking, 2 secs..... working on GPRS here.
sudo tune2fs -m 1 /dev/loop0    (That would move the reserved blocks to 1 percent)
ok, I'll try it
Let me know if this works for you.
ok, there is more free space now
Thanks for the feedback.
The discrepancy was caused by reserved space.
ssta : does the 'Size' of df output include the reserved size?
It already has reserved space deducted from the percent free.  Hence why 100% full even though you appeared to have 2GB free.
Try calculating in blocks, not GiB or GB.  You might be seeing a rounding issue.
